case_title: Mst. ZOHRA BEGUM vs MUHAMMAD NAWAZ SHAD, ADVOCATE, RAWALPINDI

allegations.initial_suit: Filed by respondent on behalf of complainant regarding property evidenced in registered sale-deed Nos. 2297 and 2296 (2 Ks. 12 Ms.)

mutation_details.application_result: Allowed by Deputy Commissioner, substituting previous entries with complainant's name

allegations.misconduct: Respondent filed a civil suit challenging Mutation No. 6852 on behalf of third parties (Muhammad Pervaiz Khan and Rahim Dil Khan) while complainant's suit was still pending.

respondent_defense: Claimed the property in the suit filed on behalf of third parties was different from the property in complainant's suit.

tribunal_findings.misconduct: Respondent's actions fell under Section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Council Act, 1973 and Rule 145 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Council Rules, 1976.
tribunal_findings.rule_reference: Rule 156 cited by respondent was deemed irrelevant.
